headline: Graham Cracker Crust
description: Make a graham cracker crust from-scratch for baked or no-bake pies with just 3 ingredients with this super easy recipe that's ready in minutes.

video.description: This basic graham cracker crust that works well for baked and unbaked pies.
video.name: Graham Cracker Crust I

name: Graham Cracker Crust
recipeIngredient: 1.5 cups finely ground graham cracker crumbs

recipeInstructions.text: Combine graham cracker crumbs, sugar, melted butter, and cinnamon in a mixing bowl; mix until well blended. Press mixture into the bottom and up the sides of an 8- or 9-inch pie plate.
Follow directions for a baked or no-bake crust.

review.reviewBody: very easy but also found that reading reviews on the number of crackers to use to make crust was incorrect. NOT a whole box for 1 pie. extra does freeze well and added more butter so it stays together better. no sugar in my crust. It's sweet enough
Delicious graham cracker crust! Super easy to make, buttery and was perfect for my peanut butter pie! Will be using this again, for sure-yum! Thanks for sharing üòä

Pie rookie here, used half grahmcrackers half spiced cookies and brown sugar for Christmas Dutch Apple pie. Everyone was amazed with the crust and flavor. Was my first attempt at making my own crust and I will be using again.
I think baking this crust for 10 minutes at 350* really helps. :) Cool before filling.

I used light brown sugar instead of the refined white sugar. And a handy dandy top.... I used regular Graham crackers, I started breaking the crackers and when I had most of them smashed up I put them all thru a wire mesh strainer. I used the mortar to finish grinding the crackers. I had my entire crust nice and fine. No big chunks to contend with. It took 3 to 4 minutes to feed all the crackers thru the strainer and very well worth the time.

taste great but, i read and several reviews stated that they could feel the grit of sugar in their crust so, i decided to melt the sugar in the warm butter. Bad idea. Crust tasted great but, the melted sugar turned it into concrete. i had to chip it out of the pie pan bending a metal spatula and sending pie shrapnel all over the kitchen ruining my pie and spatula. this was my fault, not the recipe's.
Simple & sweet. The cinnamon really makes it great.
Easy to follow

I omitted the sugar and cinnamon. Used 3 cup‚Äôs Graham crackers crumbs to 12 tsp of butter and it was perfect consistency then I bake for 9 mins at 350. FYI I used my food processor to make the crumbs. 3 full packs of Graham crackers or 1 full standard box. I had enough for 2 pie crusts. I use the crusts for my chocolate pie at Thanksgiving!
Fantastic! Used this in the bottom of my ball jars for pumpkin pie mousse!
I used Annie‚Äôs organic, gluten free graham crackers; half chocolate and half honey. Wonderful for my homemade strawberry/fresh basil cheese cake. I‚Äôll share with anyone who would like my recipe.
My Favorite by far. Use for any recipe that calls for Graham Cracker Crust.
Way too much sugar. Doesn‚Äôt taste like graham crackers‚Ä¶ taste like straight sugar.
I substituted a box of kinnikinnick gluten free graham crackers and baked the crust at 350* for about 8 minutes. We‚Äôve had fresh GF strawberry pie multiple times with this crust. It‚Äôs delicious!
I made this recipe but changed it to Nilla Cookies and it worked out üí™ perfectly to make a Lemon Posset tart! Thanks üôè Chef Jeffrey
Just a gooey mess
This goes great with the Peanut Butter Pie recipe!!

I've used this crust for decades, and it is the best. Using Honey Maid Graham Cracker Crust (or homemade from HM) makes all the difference in texture. I don't put cinnamon in my crust, but that is my personal preference. I could eat this crust by itself!
I lost my recipe for graham cracker crust replacing the sugar with honey. Much, much better than using white sugar and a lot better nutrition-wise.
Good crust.
Absolutely perfect! When I made Peanut Butter pie, I substituted oreos for the graham crackers and omitted the sugar...Amazing!!
Excellent
Easy and very tasty. I did not add cinnamon to this crust.

~~ There're several comments about the crust being crusty, hard as a rock, &c.
The problem is Nabisco's original recipe did NOT call for the butter to be melted, but rather cut in to the crumbs, just like making pie dough.
I'd been making this crust for several years whenabout 20 years ago, out of nowhere, it began turning out lousy. Come to find out Nabisco had chosen to reduce the number of crackers in a sleeve from 11 to nine, so I had to make the adjustment to get the original great pie crust.
As always -- hth, fwiw, and imho....
kenn 
war4what@fastmail.com

Awesome easy to follow recipe. Made it for my sweet potato pie. 
Thank you!!

I've made graham cracker crusts for years - this year I am going to add the cinnamon! One thing I wanted to mention, when I first started making these crusts, I would find my filling would ooze out of the bottom. I realized my graham cracker crust was not evenly pressed into the pie pan. So, now when I get the graham cracker mixture all pressed in, I hold the pan up to the light and can see exactly where there are thin spots & fix them. I use this crust for my cherry cheesecakes.
Easy and simple to make

This recipe is great as is, but because of humidity and other stuff, you may have to tweak the amount of butter it takes to get the right texture. It also may take a bit of practice to get the crumbs pressed into the dish evenly, but it still tastes great! After making it a couple of times, my family has discovered that we prefer less sugar, but that is our personal taste, not a failure of the recipe.

This recipe has too much sugar and butter in it. It was tough and inedible. I made two pumpkin cheesecake pies using this recipe for homecoming at my church. I have never been so embarrassed over anything else that I have cooked. Will never use it again.
Easy to make and super tasty. Melted chocolate on the bottom of mine and topped off with pumpkin pie!
So good! I used a tablespoon less of butter to avoid greasiness and added both finely ground and chunky bits for texture variation. Turned out really well!

I made it according to recipe with homemade graham crackers crushed with a mortar and pestle. I felt it was a bit too crumbly and will probably make it with more butter next time; however, I will not be adding too much, for a crumbly graham cracker crust basically is necessary in my book. Everything else was divine!
Good
I used this for cheesecake and it was delish!

Easy and delicious....I use Nabisco Original Grahams (at Publix) rather than Honey Graham‚Äôs and the ‚Äúsweetness‚Äù is just right. Be careful with the cinnamon - the recommended amount is too much for me so I either reduce or omit.
This is the perfect go to graham cracker crust recipe. I cut back a little on the sugar because I use Honey Maid Grahams but otherwise it‚Äôs perfect!

Easy and very tasty. I bake it then fill it before I put it in the refrigerator and I find the crust can be cut much easer after allowed to reach room temperature before serving. It holds its shape as it is cut and served.

I use this recipe again and again for key lime pie crust. Makes a delicious, thick graham cracker crust which is easy to make. I put everything in the food processor (1 sleeve plus 3 additional graham crackers = 1.5 cups of crumbs once pulverized in processor) then pour onto pie plate, press into sides and bottom then bake. Thanks for the recipe!

This is a great crust! I used it for a key lime pie so I omitted the cinnamon. It was delicious and there was plenty of crust to coat a 9 inch dish. It held together well after it was baked and it was nice and crunchy.
I haven't used this recipe before but I'm trying it for "Dolly Bars", hope they will stay together and form on the bottom of the pan. Fingers crossed.
Perfect combo of Graham and Sugar Combo. I added Ginger and Cinnamon to crust, 1 tsp each.
Easy to follow directions and a great crust.

too much butter made for a wet goo 
it was good after another cup of Graham crackers added
Doubled it fir a deep dish. Grocery stores do not carry these that much anymore
Turned out good except it's very sweet. Next time will use 1/4 cup sugar so it's less sweet.Used whole graham crackers and just blended them in a blender -super easy and fast.

Love it - never fails. My kids love key lime pie, so I make this crust and then hop on over to one of the key lime pie recipes. I‚Äôm actually making individual cupcake size key lime pies today. You won‚Äôt go wrong with this one!
I made this crust, but I made it using a Spring Foam Pan. It was delicious. It‚Äôs a very simple recipe and with delicious results.
I just left ot he cinnamon because I'm not a fan. I used it for my Godiva chocolate pudding pie.
Tasty I love Do it yourself recipes. This was a wonderful gram cracker crust
Awesome quick easy recipe
Excellent!
Too gooey. The top of the pie crust overflowed onto the pie & stuck to the pie plate. The addition of cinnamon was different.
So delicious! I love this recipe! I for sure will reccomend it in the future!
Delicious! I used ultra fine sugar and honey maid graham crackers as another person suggested.
This recipe is great but i add Extra butter and a little extra sugar because the crust is our favorite part of a cheesecake
Way to much butter! It was bubbling up over my pie. Next time I'll halve it.

It didn‚Äôt came out like a pie crust 
I follow the recipe 
I use a mixer insted of a food processor
Perfect and a delicious crust for a new cheesecake recipe we tried. Made it exactly as published. Will definitely make this again.
My family absolutely loved this crust. They didn't even care about the cream pie it was filled with, they just wanted to eat more of the crust.

I thought there was only one way to make a graham cracker crust, apparently not. I should have compared other recipes (which, for the record, call for about 1 tbsp sugar, not 1/3 cup!). It tasted like a super sweet cookie covered in sugar not bad just not at all what I wanted and not at all what went well with my pudding, I scooped out my pudding from the crust and ate it plain bc the crust was way too sweet.

This graham cracker crust was delicious. Much better than the ones I buy at the grocery store that are already made. I cut down a little on the sugar and did not add the cinnamon. I made a frozen lime pie to put in it and did not think the cinnamon would be a good addition. I will definitely make this crust in the future.

I joined this site just to leave a review for this crust because I always use it. Thank you so much for giving us this recipe. I always get compliments on the crust when I make my cheesecakes. The only adjustments I make it add two tablespoons of dark brown sugar and omit the cinnamon and it comes out just perfect everytime.
Easy and delicious!
Tastes AMAZING, only problem I had was that it wasn‚Äôt as stiff as I would‚Äôve liked. But still, AMAZING
Great recipe
So easy and so, so good! Even my son-in-law said he loved it and could just eat a plate full of crust!
Well I put root beer pie in it and I haven‚Äôt tried it yet but it turned out great!
I used Maria cookies and Hersheys mini chips which melted on the just out of the oven crust. This will be the base for my Banana Cream Pie!

First thing I noticed was that the the amount for the ingredients is not accurate. I upped the the crumbs to 2 cups, reduced the sugar to 3 tbsp added 1/4 tsp salt, and omitted the cinnamon altogether. Depending on what you're making the cinnamon can be a good addition, just not for everything. 
Mixed that together and baked for 10 mins instead of 7. Came out great.
Easy and way better than store bought crust!
Sooo easy and delicious! One of the best I‚Äôve tried!
I used animal crackers (we were out of graham crackers) and added a little honey, it turned out perfectly! I didn‚Äôt add the cinnamon, and it complimented my banana pudding pie perfectl
Truly the best!

Awesome!!! My 14 yr. old granddaughter made this to go with the Key Lime Pie Vll and it was perfect for a family celebration. Everyone really liked it. I did add just a bit more butter to make it less crumbly and a little easier to work into the baking dish.

So great for using up graham crackers. Don‚Äôt need so much crackers. Even 3 individual serving packets will do. Definitely recommend freezing for an hour before using. The melted butter spreads out all the other ingredients and then hardens nicely to fill out with heaping apple slice while still keeping its shape. Used it twice and absolutely love it. I used foil 8 inch pie dish and worked great. Also tried using apple sauce instead of sugar and also worked great. Also used up old cookies too. No need to grind it fine. I just mashed with hands and kids liked it so much they ate leftover in bowl. This will be my go to for pie crust and will never buy crust again.
Easy & perfect! Worked like a charm
An excellent basic recipe!
Tastes great! Nice flavor and texture. Will make again!
Very good.
Make receipt exactly came out great
Chocolate graham crackers
I love this crust with fresh strawberry pie. It never gets soggy. I put the crackers in a food processor to crush. Much faster and easier.
Great foundation for key lime pie!
I used this recipe but replaced the graham crackers with Nilla Wafers for a banana pie, worked great!
It was great, just like it was! I used a little less sugar. Well, actually I used Stevia.
sooooo great! Made a key lime pie with it and it turned out amazing!
No matter how good the pie I make, they always rave about this crust.

Perfect. Thank goodness the store was out of premade ones. I now know that making my own is easy and tastes so much better. Tips: if it came out too gooey, the butter was too warm when you added it. Cinnamon graham crackers make this taste amazing. I used one packet plus half of a tablet. Mixing with my hand and sort of tossing it around with my fingers worked best
Easy and good!
I love this crust with the cinnamon it was perfect for making a homemade new york cheesecake!
Wonderful got what he family done in no time.....

I have used this crust recipe for about 20 pies. Most of them have been lemon meringue or key lime pies. This is my absolute favorite. 

It is simple and classic. I do not change anything. When I serve or give away a pie, I always get compliments on the crust.
Perfect! Every time! We press it firmly in the pan so the pie cute nicely and doesn't flake when cut. YUM!
I'm excited about it! We're using it for the crust on a Maple Cheesecake!!
Very easy to make and delicious!

Super simple. Used 1/4 c. sugar. My go to pie crust now. Texture should be sandy. Did not understand someone's comment about texture being too gooey. Delicious for cream cheese cherry pie or lemon pie.
Great recipe. I did cut down on the sugar other than that deviation no problems.
I made it according to the recipe except I left it in the oven for a couple extra minutes. It was really really good!
Super easy to make. I did not include the cinnamon because I didn't think my husband would like it with that added. He loved the crust. I will definitely keep using this recipe.
